js.npmDescription: Base classes for kurento media server api

remoteClasses.name: MediaObject
remoteClasses.doc: Base for all objects that can be created in the media server.

properties.name: mediaPipeline
properties.doc: :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which this MediaObject belong, or the pipeline itself if invoked over a :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline`

properties.name: parent
properties.doc: parent of this media object. The type of the parent depends on the type of the element. The parent of a :rom:cls:`MediaPad` is its :rom:cls:`MediaElement`; the parent of a :rom:cls:`Hub` or a :rom:cls:`MediaElement` is its :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline`. A :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` has no parent, i.e. the property is null

properties.name: id
properties.doc: unique identifier of the mediaobject.

properties.name: childs
properties.doc: Childs of current object, all returned objects have parent set to current object

properties.name: name
properties.doc: Object name. This is just a comodity to simplify developers life debugging, it is not used internally for indexing nor idenfiying the objects. By default is the object type followed by the object id.

properties.name: sendTagsInEvents
properties.doc: This property allows activate/deactivate sending the element tags in all its events.

properties.name: creationTime
properties.doc: Number of seconds since Epoch when the element was created

methods.name: addTag
methods.doc:
Request a SessionSpec offer.

   This can be used to initiate a connection.

params.name: key
params.doc: Key of the tag

params.name: value
params.doc: Value of the tag

methods.name: removeTag
methods.doc: Remove the tag (key and value) associated to a tag

params.name: key
params.doc: Key of the tag to remove

methods.name: getTag
methods.doc: Returns the value associated to the given key.

params.name: key
params.doc: Tag key.

return.doc: The value associated to the given key.

methods.name: getTags
methods.doc: Returns all the MediaObject tags.

return.doc: An array containing all pairs key-value associated to the MediaObject.

remoteClasses.name: ServerManager
remoteClasses.doc: This is a standalone object for managing the MediaServer

properties.name: info
properties.doc: Server information, version, modules, factories, etc

properties.name: pipelines
properties.doc: All the pipelines available in the server

properties.name: sessions
properties.doc: All active sessions in the server

properties.name: metadata
properties.doc: Metadata stored in the server

methods.name: getKmd
methods.doc: Returns the kmd associated to a module

params.name: moduleName
params.doc: Name of the module to get its kmd file

remoteClasses.name: SessionEndpoint
remoteClasses.doc: Session based endpoint. A session is considered to be started when the media exchange starts. On the other hand, sessions terminate when a timeout, defined by the developer, takes place after the connection is lost.

remoteClasses.name: Hub
remoteClasses.doc: A Hub is a routing :rom:cls:`MediaObject`. It connects several :rom:cls:`endpoints <Endpoint>` together

remoteClasses.name: Filter
remoteClasses.doc: Base interface for all filters. This is a certain type of :rom:cls:`MediaElement`, that processes media injected through its sinks, and delivers the outcome through its sources.

remoteClasses.name: Endpoint
remoteClasses.doc:
Base interface for all end points. An Endpoint is a :rom:cls:`MediaElement`
that allow :term:`KMS` to interchange media contents with external systems,
supporting different transport protocols and mechanisms, such as :term:`RTP`,
:term:`WebRTC`, :term:`HTTP`, ``file:/`` URLs... An ``Endpoint`` may
contain both sources and sinks for different media types, to provide
bidirectional communication.

remoteClasses.name: HubPort
remoteClasses.doc: This :rom:cls:`MediaElement` specifies a connection with a :rom:cls:`Hub`

params.name: hub
params.doc: :rom:cls:`Hub` to which this port belongs

remoteClasses.name: PassThrough
remoteClasses.doc: This :rom:cls:`MediaElement` that just passes media through

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: the :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which the element belongs

remoteClasses.name: UriEndpoint
remoteClasses.doc: Interface for endpoints the require a URI to work. An example of this, would be a :rom:cls:`PlayerEndpoint` whose URI property could be used to locate a file to stream

properties.name: uri
properties.doc: The uri for this endpoint.

methods.name: pause
methods.doc: Pauses the feed

methods.name: stop
methods.doc: Stops the feed

remoteClasses.name: MediaPipeline
remoteClasses.doc: A pipeline is a container for a collection of :rom:cls:`MediaElements<MediaElement>` and :rom:cls:`MediaMixers<MediaMixer>`. It offers the methods needed to control the creation and connection of elements inside a certain pipeline.

properties.name: latencyStats
properties.doc: If statistics about pipeline latency are enabled for all mediaElements

methods.name: getGstreamerDot
methods.doc: Returns a string in dot (graphviz) format that represents the gstreamer elements inside the pipeline

params.name: details
params.doc: Details of graph

remoteClasses.name: SdpEndpoint
remoteClasses.doc: Implements an SDP negotiation endpoint able to generate and process offers/responses and that configures resources according to negotiated Session Description

properties.name: maxVideoRecvBandwidth
properties.doc:
Maximum video bandwidth for receiving.
  Unit: kbps(kilobits per second).
   0: unlimited.
  Default value: 500

methods.name: generateOffer
methods.doc:
Request a SessionSpec offer.

   This can be used to initiate a connection.

methods.name: processOffer
methods.doc: Request the NetworkConnection to process the given SessionSpec offer (from the remote User Agent)

params.name: offer
params.doc: SessionSpec offer from the remote User Agent

return.doc: The chosen configuration from the ones stated in the SDP offer

methods.name: processAnswer
methods.doc: Request the NetworkConnection to process the given SessionSpec answer (from the remote User Agent).

params.name: answer
params.doc: SessionSpec answer from the remote User Agent

return.doc: Updated SDP offer, based on the answer received.

methods.name: getLocalSessionDescriptor
methods.doc:
This method gives access to the SessionSpec offered by this NetworkConnection.

.. note:: This method returns the local MediaSpec, negotiated or not. If no offer has been generated yet, it returns null. It an offer has been generated it returns the offer and if an answer has been processed it returns the negotiated local SessionSpec.

methods.name: getRemoteSessionDescriptor
methods.doc:
This method gives access to the remote session description.

.. note:: This method returns the media previously agreed after a complete offer-answer exchange. If no media has been agreed yet, it returns null.

return.doc: The last agreed User Agent session description

remoteClasses.name: BaseRtpEndpoint
remoteClasses.doc: Base class to manage common RTP features.

properties.name: minVideoRecvBandwidth
properties.doc:
Minimum video bandwidth for receiving.
  Unit: kbps(kilobits per second).
   0: unlimited.
  Default value: 100

properties.name: minVideoSendBandwidth
properties.doc:
Minimum video bandwidth for sending.
  Unit: kbps(kilobits per second).
   0: unlimited.
  Default value: 100

properties.name: maxVideoSendBandwidth
properties.doc:
Maximum video bandwidth for sending.
  Unit: kbps(kilobits per second).
   0: unlimited.
  Default value: 500

properties.name: mediaState
properties.doc: State of the media

properties.name: connectionState
properties.doc: State of the connection

properties.name: rembParams
properties.doc: Parameters of the congestion control algorithm

remoteClasses.name: MediaElement
remoteClasses.doc:
Basic building blocks of the media server, that can be interconnected through the API. A :rom:cls:`MediaElement` is a module that encapsulates a specific media capability. They can be connected to create media pipelines where those capabilities are applied, in sequence, to the stream going through the pipeline.

   :rom:cls:`MediaElement` objects are classified by its supported media type (audio, video, etc.)

methods.name: getSourceConnections
methods.doc: Get the connections information of the elements that are sending media to this element :rom:cls:`MediaElement`

params.name: mediaType
params.doc: One of :rom:attr:`MediaType.AUDIO`, :rom:attr:`MediaType.VIDEO` or :rom:attr:`MediaType.DATA`

params.name: description
params.doc: A textual description of the media source. Currently not used, aimed mainly for :rom:attr:`MediaType.DATA` sources

return.doc: A list of the connections information that are sending media to this element. The list will be empty if no sources are found.

methods.name: getSinkConnections
methods.doc: Returns a list of the connections information of the elements that ere receiving media from this element.

params.name: mediaType
params.doc: One of :rom:attr:`MediaType.AUDIO`, :rom:attr:`MediaType.VIDEO` or :rom:attr:`MediaType.DATA`

params.name: description
params.doc: A textual description of the media source. Currently not used, aimed mainly for :rom:attr:`MediaType.DATA` sources

return.doc: A list of the connections information that arereceiving media from this element. The list will be empty if no sinks are found.

methods.name: connect
methods.doc: Connects two elements, with the given restrictions, current :rom:cls:`MediaElement` will start emmit media to sink element. Connection could take place in the future, when both media element show capabilities for connecting with the given restrictions

params.name: sink
params.doc: the target :rom:cls:`MediaElement` that will receive media

params.name: mediaType
params.doc: the :rom:enum:`MediaType` of the pads that will be connected

params.name: sourceMediaDescription
params.doc: A textual description of the media source. Currently not used, aimed mainly for :rom:attr:`MediaType.DATA` sources

params.name: sinkMediaDescription
params.doc: A textual description of the media source. Currently not used, aimed mainly for :rom:attr:`MediaType.DATA` sources

methods.name: disconnect
methods.doc: Disconnects two elements, with the given restrictions, current :rom:cls:`MediaElement` stops sending media to sink element. If the previously requested connection didn't took place it is also removed

params.name: sink
params.doc: the target :rom:cls:`MediaElement` that will stop receiving media

params.name: mediaType
params.doc: the :rom:enum:`MediaType` of the pads that will be connected

params.name: sourceMediaDescription
params.doc: A textual description of the media source. Currently not used, aimed mainly for :rom:attr:`MediaType.DATA` sources

params.name: sinkMediaDescription
params.doc: A textual description of the media source. Currently not used, aimed mainly for :rom:attr:`MediaType.DATA` sources

methods.name: setAudioFormat
methods.doc: Sets the type of data for the audio stream. MediaElements that do not support configuration of audio capabilities will raise an exception

params.name: caps
params.doc: The format for the stream of audio

methods.name: setVideoFormat
methods.doc: Sets the type of data for the video stream. MediaElements that do not support configuration of video capabilities will raise an exception

params.name: caps
params.doc: The format for the stream of video

methods.name: getGstreamerDot
methods.doc: Returns a string in dot (graphviz) format that represents the gstreamer elements inside

params.name: details
params.doc: Details of graph

methods.name: setOutputBitrate
methods.doc:
@deprecated
Allows change the target bitrate for the media output, if the media is encoded using VP8 or H264. This method only works if it is called before the media starts to flow.

params.name: bitrate
params.doc: Configure the enconding media bitrate in bps

methods.name: getStats
methods.doc: Provides statistics collected for this endpoint

params.name: mediaType
params.doc: One of :rom:attr:`MediaType.AUDIO` or :rom:attr:`MediaType.VIDEO`

return.doc: Delivers a successful result in the form of a RTC stats report. A RTC stats report represents a map between strings, identifying the inspected objects (RTCStats.id), and their corresponding RTCStats objects.

properties.name: minOuputBitrate
properties.doc:
Minimum video bandwidth for transcoding.
  Unit: bps(bits per second).
  Default value: 0

properties.name: maxOuputBitrate
properties.doc:
Maximum video bandwidth for transcoding.
  Unit: bps(bits per second).
  Default value: MAXINT

complexTypes.name: ServerInfo
complexTypes.doc: Description of the mediaserver

properties.name: version
properties.doc: MediaServer version

properties.name: modules
properties.doc: Descriptor of all modules loaded by the server

properties.name: type
properties.doc: Describes the type of mediaserver

properties.name: capabilities
properties.doc: Describes the capabilities that this server supports

complexTypes.name: ServerType
complexTypes.doc: Indicates if the server is a real media server or a proxy

complexTypes.name: GstreamerDotDetails
complexTypes.doc: Details of gstreamer dot graphs

complexTypes.name: ModuleInfo
complexTypes.doc: Description of a loaded modules

properties.name: version
properties.doc: Module version

properties.name: name
properties.doc: Module name

properties.name: factories
properties.doc: Module available factories

complexTypes.name: MediaState
complexTypes.doc: State of the media.

complexTypes.name: ConnectionState
complexTypes.doc: State of the connection.

complexTypes.name: MediaType
complexTypes.doc:
Type of media stream to be exchanged.
Can take the values AUDIO, DATA or VIDEO.

complexTypes.name: FilterType
complexTypes.doc:
Type of filter to be created.
Can take the values AUDIO, VIDEO or AUTODETECT.

complexTypes.name: VideoCodec
complexTypes.doc: Codec used for transmission of video.

complexTypes.name: AudioCodec
complexTypes.doc: Codec used for transmission of audio.

properties.name: numerator
properties.doc: the numerator of the fraction

properties.name: denominator
properties.doc: the denominator of the fraction

complexTypes.name: Fraction
complexTypes.doc: Type that represents a fraction of an integer numerator over an integer denominator

properties.name: codec
properties.doc: Audio codec

properties.name: bitrate
properties.doc: Bitrate

complexTypes.name: AudioCaps
complexTypes.doc: Format for audio media

properties.name: codec
properties.doc: Video codec

properties.name: framerate
properties.doc: Framerate

complexTypes.name: VideoCaps
complexTypes.doc: Format for video media

properties.name: source
properties.doc: The source element in the connection

properties.name: sink
properties.doc: The sink element in the connection

properties.name: type
properties.doc: MediaType of the connection

properties.name: sourceDescription
properties.doc: Description of source media. Could be emty.

properties.name: sinkDescription
properties.doc: Description of sink media. Could be emty.

complexTypes.name: Tag
complexTypes.doc: Pair key-value with info about a MediaObject

properties.name: key
properties.doc: Tag key

properties.name: value
properties.doc: Tag Value

complexTypes.name: StatsType
complexTypes.doc: The type of the object.

complexTypes.name: Stats
complexTypes.doc: A dictionary that represents the stats gathered.

properties.name: id
properties.doc: A unique id that is associated with the object that was inspected to produce this Stats object.

properties.name: type
properties.doc: The type of this object.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.doc: The timestamp associated with this object. The time is relative to the UNIX epoch (Jan 1, 1970, UTC).

complexTypes.name: ElementStats
complexTypes.doc: A dictionary that represents the stats gathered in the media element.

properties.name: inputAudioLatency
properties.doc: Audio average measured on the sink pad in nano seconds

properties.name: inputVideoLatency
properties.doc: Video average measured on the sink pad in nano seconds

complexTypes.name: EndpointStats
complexTypes.doc: A dictionary that represents the stats gathered in the endpoint element.

properties.name: audioE2ELatency
properties.doc: End-to-end audio latency measured in nano seconds

properties.name: videoE2ELatency
properties.doc: End-to-end video latency measured in nano seconds

complexTypes.name: RTCStats
complexTypes.doc: An RTCStats dictionary represents the stats gathered.

complexTypes.name: RTCRTPStreamStats
complexTypes.doc: Statistics for the RTP stream

properties.name: ssrc
properties.doc: The synchronized source SSRC

properties.name: associateStatsId
properties.doc: The associateStatsId is used for looking up the corresponding (local/remote) RTCStats object for a given SSRC.

properties.name: isRemote
properties.doc: false indicates that the statistics are measured locally, while true indicates that the measurements were done at the remote endpoint and reported in an RTCP RR/XR.

properties.name: mediaTrackId
properties.doc: Track identifier.

properties.name: transportId
properties.doc: It is a unique identifier that is associated to the object that was inspected to produce the RTCTransportStats associated with this RTP stream.

properties.name: codecId
properties.doc: The codec identifier

properties.name: firCount
properties.doc: Count the total number of Full Intra Request (FIR) packets received by the sender. This metric is only valid for video and is sent by receiver.

properties.name: pliCount
properties.doc: Count the total number of Packet Loss Indication (PLI) packets received by the sender and is sent by receiver.

properties.name: nackCount
properties.doc: Count the total number of Negative ACKnowledgement (NACK) packets received by the sender and is sent by receiver.

properties.name: sliCount
properties.doc: Count the total number of Slice Loss Indication (SLI) packets received by the sender. This metric is only valid for video and is sent by receiver.

properties.name: remb
properties.doc: The Receiver Estimated Maximum Bitrate (REMB). This metric is only valid for video.

properties.name: packetsLost
properties.doc: Total number of RTP packets lost for this SSRC.

properties.name: fractionLost
properties.doc: The fraction packet loss reported for this SSRC.

complexTypes.name: RTCCodec
complexTypes.doc: RTC codec statistics

properties.name: payloadType
properties.doc: Payload type as used in RTP encoding.

properties.name: codec
properties.doc: e.g., video/vp8 or equivalent.

properties.name: clockRate
properties.doc: Represents the media sampling rate.

properties.name: channels
properties.doc: Use 2 for stereo, missing for most other cases.

properties.name: parameters
properties.doc: From the SDP description line.

complexTypes.name: RTCInboundRTPStreamStats
complexTypes.doc: Statistics that represents the measurement metrics for the incoming media stream.

properties.name: packetsReceived
properties.doc: Total number of RTP packets received for this SSRC.

properties.name: bytesReceived
properties.doc: Total number of bytes received for this SSRC.

properties.name: jitter
properties.doc: Packet Jitter measured in seconds for this SSRC.

complexTypes.name: RTCOutboundRTPStreamStats
complexTypes.doc: Statistics that represents the measurement metrics for the outgoing media stream.

properties.name: packetsSent
properties.doc: Total number of RTP packets sent for this SSRC.

properties.name: bytesSent
properties.doc: Total number of bytes sent for this SSRC.

properties.name: targetBitrate
properties.doc: Presently configured bitrate target of this SSRC, in bits per second.

properties.name: roundTripTime
properties.doc: Estimated round trip time (seconds) for this SSRC based on the RTCP timestamp.

complexTypes.name: RTCPeerConnectionStats
complexTypes.doc: Statistics related to the peer connection.

properties.name: dataChannelsOpened
properties.doc: Represents the number of unique datachannels opened.

properties.name: dataChannelsClosed
properties.doc: Represents the number of unique datachannels closed.

complexTypes.name: RTCMediaStreamStats
complexTypes.doc: Statistics related to the media stream.

properties.name: streamIdentifier
properties.doc: Stream identifier.

properties.name: trackIds
properties.doc: This is the id of the stats object, not the track.id.

complexTypes.name: RTCMediaStreamTrackStats
complexTypes.doc: Statistics related to the media stream.

properties.name: trackIdentifier
properties.doc: Represents the track.id property.

properties.name: remoteSource
properties.doc: true indicates that this is a remote source. false in other case.

properties.name: ssrcIds
properties.doc: Synchronized sources.

properties.name: frameWidth
properties.doc: Only makes sense for video media streams and represents the width of the video frame for this SSRC.

properties.name: frameHeight
properties.doc: Only makes sense for video media streams and represents the height of the video frame for this SSRC.

properties.name: framesPerSecond
properties.doc: Only valid for video. It represents the nominal FPS value.

properties.name: framesSent
properties.doc: Only valid for video. It represents the total number of frames sent for this SSRC.

properties.name: framesReceived
properties.doc: Only valid for video and when remoteSource is set to true. It represents the total number of frames received for this SSRC.

properties.name: framesDecoded
properties.doc: Only valid for video. It represents the total number of frames correctly decoded for this SSRC.

properties.name: framesDropped
properties.doc: Only valid for video. The total number of frames dropped predecode or dropped because the frame missed its display deadline.

properties.name: framesCorrupted
properties.doc: Only valid for video. The total number of corrupted frames that have been detected.

properties.name: audioLevel
properties.doc: Only valid for audio, and the value is between 0..1 (linear), where 1.0 represents 0 dBov.

properties.name: echoReturnLoss
properties.doc: Only present on audio tracks sourced from a microphone where echo cancellation is applied. Calculated in decibels.

properties.name: echoReturnLossEnhancement
properties.doc: Only present on audio tracks sourced from a microphone where echo cancellation is applied.

complexTypes.name: RTCDataChannelState
complexTypes.doc: Represents the state of the RTCDataChannel

complexTypes.name: RTCDataChannelStats
complexTypes.doc: Statistics related to RTC data channels.

properties.name: label
properties.doc: The RTCDatachannel label.

properties.name: protocol
properties.doc: The protocol used.

properties.name: datachannelid
properties.doc: The RTCDatachannel identifier.

properties.name: state
properties.doc: The state of the RTCDatachannel.

properties.name: messagesSent
properties.doc: Represents the total number of API 'message' events sent.

properties.name: bytesSent
properties.doc: Represents the total number of payload bytes sent on this RTCDatachannel, i.e., not including headers or padding.

properties.name: messagesReceived
properties.doc: Represents the total number of API 'message' events received.

properties.name: bytesReceived
properties.doc: Represents the total number of bytes received on this RTCDatachannel, i.e., not including headers or padding.

complexTypes.name: RTCTransportStats
complexTypes.doc: Statistics related to RTC data channels.

properties.name: bytesSent
properties.doc: Represents the total number of payload bytes sent on this PeerConnection, i.e., not including headers or padding.

properties.name: bytesReceived
properties.doc: Represents the total number of bytes received on this PeerConnection, i.e., not including headers or padding.

properties.name: rtcpTransportStatsId
properties.doc: If RTP and RTCP are not multiplexed, this is the id of the transport that gives stats for the RTCP component, and this record has only the RTP component stats.

properties.name: activeConnection
properties.doc: Set to true when transport is active.

properties.name: selectedCandidatePairId
properties.doc: It is a unique identifier that is associated to the object that was inspected to produce the RTCIceCandidatePairStats associated with this transport.

properties.name: localCertificateId
properties.doc: For components where DTLS is negotiated, give local certificate.

properties.name: remoteCertificateId
properties.doc: For components where DTLS is negotiated, give remote certificate.

complexTypes.name: RTCStatsIceCandidateType
complexTypes.doc: Types of candidates

properties.name: ipAddress
properties.doc: It is the IP address of the candidate, allowing for IPv4 addresses, IPv6 addresses, and fully qualified domain names (FQDNs).

properties.name: portNumber
properties.doc: It is the port number of the candidate.

properties.name: transport
properties.doc: Valid values for transport is one of udp and tcp. Based on the 'transport' defined in [RFC5245] section 15.1.

properties.name: candidateType
properties.doc: The enumeration RTCStatsIceCandidateType is based on the cand-type defined in [RFC5245] section 15.1.

properties.name: priority
properties.doc: Represents the priority of the candidate

properties.name: addressSourceUrl
properties.doc: The URL of the TURN or STUN server indicated in the RTCIceServers that translated this IP address.

complexTypes.name: RTCStatsIceCandidatePairState
complexTypes.doc: Represents the state of the checklist for the local and remote candidates in a pair.

properties.name: transportId
properties.doc: It is a unique identifier that is associated to the object that was inspected to produce the RTCTransportStats associated with this candidate pair.

properties.name: localCandidateId
properties.doc: It is a unique identifier that is associated to the object that was inspected to produce the RTCIceCandidateAttributes for the local candidate associated with this candidate pair.

properties.name: remoteCandidateId
properties.doc: It is a unique identifier that is associated to the object that was inspected to produce the RTCIceCandidateAttributes for the remote candidate associated with this candidate pair.

properties.name: state
properties.doc: Represents the state of the checklist for the local and remote candidates in a pair.

properties.name: priority
properties.doc: Calculated from candidate priorities as defined in [RFC5245] section 5.7.2.

properties.name: nominated
properties.doc: Related to updating the nominated flag described in Section 7.1.3.2.4 of [RFC5245].

properties.name: writable
properties.doc: Has gotten ACK to an ICE request.

properties.name: readable
properties.doc: Has gotten a valid incoming ICE request.

properties.name: bytesSent
properties.doc: Represents the total number of payload bytes sent on this candidate pair, i.e., not including headers or padding.

properties.name: bytesReceived
properties.doc: Represents the total number of payload bytes received on this candidate pair, i.e., not including headers or padding.

properties.name: roundTripTime
properties.doc: Represents the RTT computed by the STUN connectivity checks

properties.name: availableOutgoingBitrate
properties.doc: Measured in Bits per second, and is implementation dependent. It may be calculated by the underlying congestion control.

properties.name: availableIncomingBitrate
properties.doc: Measured in Bits per second, and is implementation dependent. It may be calculated by the underlying congestion control.

properties.name: fingerprint
properties.doc: Only use the fingerprint value as defined in Section 5 of [RFC4572].

properties.name: fingerprintAlgorithm
properties.doc: For instance, 'sha-256'.

properties.name: base64Certificate
properties.doc: For example, DER-encoded, base-64 representation of a certifiate.

complexTypes.name: CodecConfiguration
complexTypes.doc: Defines specific configuration for codecs

properties.name: name
properties.doc: Name of the codec defined as <encoding name>/<clock rate>[/<encoding parameters>]

properties.name: properties
properties.doc: String used for tuning codec properties

complexTypes.name: RembParams
complexTypes.doc: Defines values for parameters of congestion control

properties.name: packetsRecvIntervalTop
properties.doc:
Size of the RTP packets history to smooth fraction-lost.
Units: num of packets

properties.name: exponentialFactor
properties.doc:
Factor used to increase exponentially the next REMB when it is below the threshold.
REMB[i+1] = REMB[i] * (1 + exponentialFactor)

properties.name: linealFactorMin
properties.doc:
Set the min of the factor used to increase linearly the next REMB when it is over the threshold.
Units: bps (bits per second).
REMB[i+1] = REMB[i] + MIN (linealFactorMin, linealFactor)

properties.name: linealFactorGrade
properties.doc:
Determine the value of the next linearFactor based on the threshold and the current REMB. Taking into account that the frequency of updating is 500ms, the default value makes that the last REMB is reached in 60secs.
linealFactor = (REMB - TH) / linealFactorGrade

properties.name: decrementFactor
properties.doc:
Determine how much is decreased the current REMB when too losses are detected.
REMB[i+1] = REMB[i] * decrementFactor

properties.name: thresholdFactor
properties.doc:
Determine the next threshold (TH) when too losses are detected.
TH[i+1] = REMB[i] * thresholdFactor

properties.name: upLosses
properties.doc: Max fraction-lost to no determine too losses. This value is the denominator of the fraction N/256, so the default value is about 4% of losses (12/256)

properties.name: rembOnConnect
properties.doc:
REMB propagated upstream when video sending is started in a new connected endpoint.
  Unit: bps(bits per second)

properties.name: source
properties.doc: Object that raised the event

properties.name: description
properties.doc: Textual description of the error

properties.name: errorCode
properties.doc: Server side integer error code

properties.name: type
properties.doc: Integer code as a String

events.name: Error
events.doc: An error related to the MediaObject has occurred

events.name: MediaSessionTerminated
events.doc: Event raised when a session is terminated. This event has no data.

events.name: MediaSessionStarted
events.doc: Event raised when a session starts. This event has no data.

properties.name: type
properties.doc: Type of event that was raised

events.name: Media
events.doc: Base for all events raised by elements in the Kurento media server.

events.name: ObjectCreated
events.doc: Indicates that an object has been created on the mediaserver

properties.name: object
properties.doc: The object that has been created

events.name: ObjectDestroyed
events.doc: Indicates that an object has been destroyed on the mediaserver

properties.name: objectId
properties.doc: The id of the object that has been destroyed

events.name: MediaStateChanged
events.doc: Indicates that the state of the media has changed

properties.name: oldState
properties.doc: The previous state

properties.name: newState
properties.doc: The new state

events.name: ConnectionStateChanged
events.doc: Indicates that the state of the connection has changed

properties.name: oldState
